oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Description of the Street Pageant of the Ancient Ulks on Mardi Gras Eve 1878
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Mardi Gras;
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Program of the Street Pageant of the Ancient Ulks on Mardi Gras Eve, March 4th, 1878, from 6 1/2 to 8 o' clock pm in Memphis, TN. A 14-page pamphlet describing the 10 living picture exhibits; the pictures are listed as "Muse of the Ulks", "Hey Diddle Diddle", "Jack, The Giant Killer", "Ole King Cole", "Tom, Tom the Piper's Son", "Who Killed Cock Robin", "Robinson Crusoe", "Rip Van Winkle", "Grand Uproar", and "Re-United States". [Cover only; full booklet available in Memphis and Shelby County Room.]
oai_dc:dc.dc:contributor: Manuscript collection processed by John Jones
